intro: Strigosella cabulica, commonly known as the Afghan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is known for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in its family. Strigosella cabulica is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions.
